greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of cliques of size k in all partitions of n.
comment: All parts of a number partition with the same value form a clique. The size of a clique is the number of elements in the clique.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
Abdulaziz M. Alanazi, Augustine O. Munagi, On partition configurations of Andrews-Deutsch, Integers 17 (2017), #A7.
formula: Column k is asymptotic to exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / (k*(k+1)*Pi*2^(3/2)*sqrt(n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 24 2018
maple: b:= proc(n, p, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0], `if`(p<1, [0, 0],
mathematica: Table[CoefficientList[ 1/q* Tr[Flatten[q^Map[Length, Split /@ IntegerPartitions[n], {2}]]], q], {n, 24}] (* _Wouter Meeussen_, Apr 21 2012 *)

b[n_, p_, k_] := b[n, p, k] = If[n == 0, {1, 0}, If[p < 1, {0, 0}, Sum[ Function[l, If[m == k, l + {0, l[[1]]}, l]][b[n - p*m, p - 1, k]], {m, 0, n/p}]]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n, n, k][[2]]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 29 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Row sums give: A000070(n-1). Diagonal gives: A000012.  Limit of reversed rows: T(2*n+1,n+1) = A002865(n).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 10 2011
